Posts.Content: curiousgeorgia wrote: I am sorry to bother anyone, but I am really curious about something and I hope it will give me more insight.  If you have had bloody nipple discharge, is it blatantly obvious?  For example, I just had a baby and I did not breast feed due to heart meds.  I still have some breast milk and I examine it freequently because I am so worried about BC.  Should I be doing this?  I am looking for (knock on wood) drops of blood.  Would it be little specks or just plain big spot?  Nothing comes out (again knock on wood) unless squeezed.  Are you supposed to squeeze and check?  I have heard the milk won't stop coming in unless you leave them alone, but again my fears keep making me check the stuff.  It is whitish sometimes with a tint of yellow (colostrum). I feel so stupid asking this.  Anyway, I have had a recent breast exam 2 months ago which my doctor says was good and had had an ultrasound before that because I thought I felt a thickening which my doc thought was nothing, but sent me to ease my mind.  They ended up telling me it was my inframammary ridge.   Anyway, I would really appreciate if anyone who has had this would answer me to ease my mind.  I am sick and tired of worrying about getting BC so much.  I have a beautiful baby to take care of and all I do is worry and examine myself.  Partly because I see pink ribbons everywhere and the awareness campaigns are on the rise.  I am ALL about finding a cure, but sometimes these ads do something to me. THANK YOU. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question for those who have had bloody nipple discharge curiousgeorgia barbe1958
